CatDescriptText: Mrs. Louise Davis, 2531 Wylie Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the police department states more raids in Negro neighborhoods than in white areas, because there is more crime in former districts?" answer reads: "I don't think that there is more crime in Negro neighborhoods than in the white neighborhoods. However, it seems as though Negro neighborhoods are raided more often because it is an easier place for the police arrest records."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Louise Davis wearing hoop earrings and plaid short sleeved dress, holding dark handbag over arm, standing on Fifth Avenue, May Building with Thrift Drugs in background, Downtown
